alert.note: Alert for Dillon; Florence; Horry; Marion (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 3:19AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina and northeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast North Carolina, Columbus and Robeson. In northeast South Carolina, Dillon, Florence, Horry and Marion. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 319 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion, Whiteville, Mullins, Tabor City, Chadbourn, Pamplico, Fair Bluff, Gapway, Galivants Ferry, Rains, Smithboro, Zion, Green Sea, Cherry Grove, Brittons Neck, Gresham, Kingsburg, Clarendon, Evergreen and Hyman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
